result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody John Sanda

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM Defendant Cody John Sanda in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Cody John Sanda.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman received information in 22CF370, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Hoffman asks for motion to vacate default judgment and will trail the criminal case. Court reopens traffic citations. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM Defendant Cody John Sanda in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Cody John Sanda.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman states defendant to waive preliminary hearing. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing as freely and voluntarily made. Court binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court sets arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:39 PM Defendant Cody John Sanda appeared by video with Attorney Michael Hoffman by video.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions address; defendant indicates he gets his mail at HHS.
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Not guilty plea(s) entered. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. 
State requests $5000cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Based on the nature of the charges-fled from traffic stop, rammed squad. Has had significant cb on prior cases. Does not have any failures to appear but believes that's due to the high amounts of cash bail ordered in previous files.  Reviews prior convictions. Prison sentence, probation revoked/prison.
Attorney indicates lifelong resident, family ties, unemployed, on supervision. 
Court orders $5000cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
